channel.title: PWA Tips
channel.description: Read about latest PWA's, Browser updates, new API's and its improvements in your inbox.

item.title: Issues
item.description:
Issue #13

PWA Tips Monthly Newsletter

Issue #13 | August 31, 2018

What's New?
Babel 7 Released üéâ

After almost 2 years, 4k commits, over 50 pre-releases, and a lot of help we are excited to announce the release of Babel 7.

babel
Chrome for android disabling JS

Google has added countless features to Chrome, especially the Android version, that are designed to improve functionality on slow connections.

android chrome
Puppeteer Recorder: Chrome Extension üî•

Puppeteer recorder is a Chrome extension that records your browser interactions and generates a Puppeteer script.

puppeteer
What media types your browser support?

Learn what are the media types your browser support easily.

browser
The Web Push Checklist

eCommerce sites are ideal candidates for push notifications and eBay is no exception. Timely notifications can help users track the status of items that they have purchased.

pwa push notifications
Progressive Tooling

A list of community-built, third-party tools that can be used to improve page performance.

tools

Browser Updates
What's New In DevTools (Chrome 70)?

Live Expressions in the Console, Pin an expression, Highlight DOM nodes during Eager Evaluation and many more awesome updates.

chrome
Safari Technology Preview v64

Custom Elements, Web API changes, Media updates, Web inspector and more.

safari

Articles & Tutorials
Why you should have Practice Hours as a developer?

When I was first learning to code, I was dedicating 60‚Äì70 hours a week to my coding bootcamp.

good read
Web Performance Made Easy

We've been pretty busy over the past year trying to figure out how to make the Web faster and more performant. This led to new tools, approaches and libraries that we‚Äôd like share with you in this article.

web perf
Getting started with Material Design

Material Design Components for the web (MDC Web) offers designers and developers a way to implement Material Design in their websites.

web components material design
Lighthouse score for top visited sites in India

In that post I had a very simple heuristic for determine a site in India, is it a ‚Äò.in‚Äô domain. I knew that this wasn‚Äôt the best way to look at it, but it felt like a good first go.

lighthouse perf
Extending the browser with WebAssembly

One of the best things about WebAssembly is the ability experiment with new capabilities and implement new ideas before the browser ships those features natively (if at all).

webassembly

item.title: Issues
item.description:
Issue #12

PWA Tips Monthly Newsletter

Issue #12 | July 31, 2018

What's New?
How healthy is the Internet in 2018?

Our 2018 compilation of research explains what‚Äôs helping and what‚Äôs hurting the Internet across five issues, from personal experience to global concerns.

internet mozilla
Facebook is testing a proper PWA

There are times you want to install a native app on your device to get the full experience from a service or social media platform, and times where you just want to visit the mobile site every now and then.

pwa facebook
üòç PWACompat: the Web App Manifest for all browsers

PWACompat: the Web App Manifest for all browsers You've designed a web app, wrote its code and service worker, and finally added the Web App Manifest to describe how it should behave when 'installed' on a user's device.

pwa ios android
Does my site need HTTPS ü§î

our site is a liability! Just because your site is hosted safely. in your account doesn't mean it won't travel through cables and boxes controlled by who knows how many corporate- and state-owned entities.

https security
Adblock report | thinkwithgoogle

Consumers today expect their digital experiences to be fast and seamless. If they‚Äôre not, the outcome can be costly.

thinkwithgoogle
Badging API üòá

Allows web apps (as defined by the Web App Manifest standard) to set an app-wide badge in operating-system-specific places such as the shelf or home screen.

chrome pwa

Browser Updates
Speed is now a landing page factor

For many sites this equates to a huge missed opportunity, especially when more than half of visits are abandoned if a mobile page takes over 3 seconds to load.

chrome

Articles & Tutorials
Pinterest | PWA retrospective

The idea of building a ‚ÄúProgressive Web App‚Äù (PWA) is not new, but its definition has changed with the emergence of key technologies like service workers.

casestudy pwa
The Most Hated UI & UX Pattern of 2018

Site will present you with five UI/UX design patterns, in the most horrific way possible. You carefully consider my arguments, and then pick the pattern you hate the most.

ux
Designing for the Google Assistant on Smart Displays

Earlier this year we announced Smart Displays, a new category of devices with the Google Assistant built in, that augment voice experiences with immersive visuals.

design smartdisplays
üî• 8 Video Optimization Tips | KeyCDN

Adding videos to your website can sometimes be a double-edged sword. Web users love high-resolution videos, but if your website isn‚Äôt optimized to handle them, such content can cause performance problems.

web perf
Accessibility for Teams

A ‚Äòquick-start‚Äô guide for embedding accessibility and inclusive design practices into your team‚Äôs workflow.

ally
Hacking user perception to make websites faster

In this article, Mustafa Kurtuldu cover different design devices you can use to make your experiences feel quick.

perf ux
ReportingObserver: know your code health

There's a new observer in town! ReportingObserver is a new API that lets you know when your site uses a deprecated API or runs into a browser intervention.

chrome
</div>

item.title: Issues
item.description:
Issue #11

PWA Tips Monthly Newsletter

Issue #11 | July 17, 2018

What's New?
üî• JS Cost

A JavaScript cost visualization tool.

javascript perf
Wordpress plugin for PWA

WordPress feature plugin to bring Progressive Web Apps (PWA) to Core.

wordpress pwa
Introduction to Feature Policy

Feature Policy allows web developers to selectively enable, disable, and modify the behavior of certain APIs and web features in the browser. It's like CSP but instead of controlling security, it controls features!

chrome
üé® Carbon CLI

Beautiful images of your code ‚Äî from right inside your terminal.

cli
Experimenting with First Input Delay

The goal of the Chrome User Experience Report is to help the web community understand the distribution and evolution of real user performance.

chrome uxreport
üéß Track

A WebGL Experiment by Little Workshop<

webgl webvr

Browser Updates
Site Isolation for Web Developers

Chrome 67 on desktop has a new feature called Site Isolation enabled by default.

chrome
Safari Technology Preview v60

Changed CSS Animations to take precedence over CSS Transitions, dark mode, Fixed all non-Same-Site cookies getting marked as Same-Site Strict in the Storage tab etc.

safari
See what‚Äôs new in Firefox! v61.0.1

Re-allowed downloading files from FTP sites via the "Save Link As" option when linked from HTTP pages, Web pages no longer lose focus when a browser popup window is opened and more

firefox

IDE's & Text Editor Updates
VSCode v1.25 Updates

Grid editor layout - Custom horizontal and vertical editor layout, Outline view - Symbol tree outline and navigation for your documents, Portable Mode and more

vscode

Articles & Tutorials
When 7 KB Equals 7 MB

After browsing the app a few more times, it became clear the error would occur after a small number of images were added to the cache storage by the service worker.

pwa perf
Impact of Page Weight on Load Time

Over the years it has been fun to track website page weight by comparing it to milestones such as the size of a floppy disk (1.44MB), the size of the original install size of DOOM (2.39MB) and when it hit 3MB last summer.

web perf
Seedbank - Machine Learning Examples

We call them "seeds". Each seed is a machine learning example you can start playing with. Explore, learn and grow them into whatever you like.

mechine learning examples
Whats new in React Native v0.56 üéâ

Babel 7, Modernizing Android support, New Node, Xcode, React, and Flow ‚Äì oh my! and more

reactnative
Progressive Web Apps in the HTTP Archive

In this document, we present three different approaches and discuss their particular pros and cons for extracting data about Progressive Web Apps (PWA) from the HTTP Archive.

httparchive pwa

item.title: Issues
item.description:
Issue #10

PWA Tips Monthly Newsletter

Issue #10 | June 28, 2018

What's New?
Official Puppeteer Documentation

Puppeteer is a Node library which provides a high-level API to control headless Chrome or Chromium over the DevTools Protocol.

puppeteer
Jest 23: üî• Blazing Fast Delightful Testing

Today we are excited to announce Jest 23, our largest major release to date! Together with over 100 contributors, we've shipped a ton of features and bug fixes.

jest testing
You Probably Don't Need Derived State

React v16.4 included a bugfix for getDerivedStateFromProps which caused some existing bugs in React components to reproduce more consistently.

react
JS Library Usage Over Time

An analysis of http archive data, showing JS library usage over time.

javascript perf

Browser Updates
Changes to Add to Home Screen Behavior

Since we first launched the add to home screen banner, we‚Äôve been working to label Progressive Web Apps more clearly and simplify the way users can install them.

chrome
What's new in Safari Technology Preview v59?

Safari Technology Preview v59 has Intelligent Tracking Prevention 2.0, Web Animations improvements and more.

safari
See what‚Äôs new in Firefox v61

Faster page rendering with Quantum CSS improvements and the new retained display list feature and WebExtensions now run in their own process on MacOS etc

firefox
Whats new in Samsung v7.2?

Introducing new web features such as WebGL2, Intersection Observer, Web Assembly and Protected Browsing etc,.

samsung

IDE's & Text Editor Updates
What's new in VSCode v1.24?

In this version of VSCode has many features such as Unused variable detection, Move to new file refactoring and many more

vscode
Atom v1.29 beta

Tree-sitter grammars are now parsed asynchronously for better performance and The One Light and One Dark themes now provide colors for the language-html-angular syntax grammar and more

atom

Articles & Tutorials
State of React Native 2018

At Facebook, we're using React Native more than ever and for many important projects. One of our most popular products is Marketplace, one of the top-level tabs in our app which is used by 800 million people each month.

reactnative
AI at Google: our principles

At its heart, AI is computer programming that learns and adapts. It can‚Äôt solve every problem, but its potential to improve our lives is profound.

google AI
400 Wi-Fi enabled train stations in India

For almost two centuries, train stations have launched billions of life-changing journeys in India. But now, those journeys may not even require boarding a train.

india google
Zeit: New Static Deployments

With our latest update, static deployments running on Now became almost twice as fast. Today, we are announcing the biggest set of improvements yet.

zeit static deployment
Augmented reality for the web

In Chrome v67, we announced the WebXR Device API for both augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR), though only the VR features were enabled.

chrome AR

item.title: Issues
item.description:
Issue #9

PWA Tips Monthly Newsletter

Issue #9 | May 29, 2018

What's New?
Tajawal and Almosafer Progressive Web App

It is designed by employing techniques for JavaScript performance optimization, Service Workers for network resilience and best architectural practices

pwa perf
Detect AdBlock With JavaScript

In this article I‚Äôm going to present the easiest way of implementing an AdBlock detector with JavaScript.

javascript
React v16.4.0

The latest minor release adds support for an oft-requested feature: pointer events!

react
Webpack Dashboard

This is a major update to webpack-dashboard with breaking changes. And a lot of speed and coolness.

webpack
AMP Playground

Just type away here and the AMP Validator will re-check your document on the fly. This is the minimum valid AMP HTML document.

amp
PWAFire.Org

Author of Project PWA Fire; an open source javascript and json bundle that allows you to convert your existing website into a progressive web app or build one in a few.

pwa

Browser Updates
What's new in Chrome v68?

Chrome v68 add eager Evaluation. As you type expressions, the Console previews the result and Argument hints. As you type functions, the Console shows you the expected arguments for that function etc

chrome
Samsung browser support for webpage test

WebPageTest now has first-class support for Samsung Browser across all of the Android devices (all of the Chrome features except for command-line options should work).

samsung
What's new in Safari Technology Preview v56?

In Web Inspector that recently shipped with Safari 11.1 on macOS High Sierra, the Elements tab sidebar panels and the styles editor got a lot of attention from the Web Inspector team.

safari
New in Firefox 61: Developer Edition

Firefox 61: Developer Edition is available now, and contains a ton of great new features and under-the-hood improvements.

firefox developer edition

IDE's & Text Editor Updates
Export VSCode Extensions

Here's a quick way to export your @code extensions to a markdown list (one line)

vscode
WebStorm v2018.1.4 updates

It‚Äôs now possible to run and debug tests using Karma run/debug configurations in projects generated with Angular CLI 6 and many more.

webstorm
What's new in Atom v1.27?

Atom 1.27 brings numerous improvements to your Git and GitHub workflows, including support for multiple co-authors, separate amend and undo etc.

atom
Sublime Text 3.1 Released

Added UI changes, Text rendering, color schemes, syntax definitions and lot more.

sublime

Articles & Tutorials
How to display a "new version available" for a Progressive Web App

Have you ever been on a website and noticed a popup notification that suggests that there is a new version of the site available.

pwa ux
CSS Animations vs the Web Animations API: A Case Study

The Web Animations API provides a way for developers to directly manipulate the browser's animation engine using JavaScript.

javascript web
Beyond SPAs: alternative architectures for your PWA

I'm going to cover an important, but potentially misunderstood topic: The architecture that you use for your web app, and specifically, how your architectural decisions come into play when you're building a progressive web app.

spa web
Identifying, Auditing, and Discussing Third Parties

A large part of my performance consultancy work is auditing and subsequently governing third-party scripts, dependencies, and their providers.

web perf
hello tensorflow

Machine Learning (ML) is the dope new thing that everyone's talking about, because it's really good at learning from data so that it can predict similar things in the future.

javascript tensorflow

item.title: Issues
item.description:
Issue #8

PWA Tips Monthly Newsletter

Issue #8 | September 07, 2017

What's New?
Categories Land in the Web App Manifest

Starting in early May, Rob Dolin began advocating for adding a categories member to the Web App Manifest spec.

pwa article
Node forked again over complaints of unresponsive leadership

The codebase for popular Node.js JavaScript runtime has been forked again ‚Äî the second time in less than three years.

node
A new YouTube look that works for you

When YouTube launched 12 years ago, it was a single website that supported one video format, 320x240 at 4:3 aspect ratio.

youtube polymer
Easily filter review requests by team

Review requests are a great way to ask for review on software, and with the addition of team requests you can get the feedback you need faster.

github
DOM Attributes in React v16

In the past, React used to ignore unknown DOM attributes. If you wrote JSX with an attribute that React doesn't recognize, React would just skip it.

react
Starbucks PWA

Starbucks now has beta version of its pwa which uses workbox library for its caching strategy.

pwa

Browser Updates
What's new in Chrome 61?

Chrome 61 now supports JavaScript modules natively, WebUSB API has landed, You can now use navigator.share to trigger the native Android share dialog and many more.

chrome
What's new in DevTools Chrome 62?

Support for top-level await operators in the Console, CSS Grid highlighting, Previewable cache resources, and Screenshots of a portion of the viewport and many more.

chrome devtools
Safari Technology Preview v39

Async generator runtime, input.webkitdirectory behind the flag and read to know more.

safari
Firefox Headless mode in v56+

Headless mode is a useful way to run Firefox, which is just as it sounds ‚Äî Firefox is run as normal, except without any of the UI

firefox

Editor Updates
What's new in VS Code v1.16?

JavaScript/Typescript refactoring, color picker in HTML, HTML tag auto close and many more.

vscode
Auto Import - ES6 & TS

Automatically finds, parses and provides code actions and code completion for all available imports. Works with JavaScript and TypeScript.

vscode extension

Articles & Tutorials
How We Built Our React Native App @Housing

Last year we launched our PWA with an aim to improve the experience of our users on slow and inconsistent network connections.

react native
The average web page is 3MB?

The averages we're about to look at, which are taken from the HTTP Archive, are just that ‚Äì averages of large datasets.

web perf
Polymer 3.0 Preview‚Ää

The longer title should be: Experiment with Polymer 3.0 Preview‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäBuilding a mini card game with Polymer + Typescript + Webpack.

polymer
The State of the Web

So, what is the state of the Web today? Only 46% of 7.4 billion people on this planet have access to the Internet.

web perf
ECMAScript proposals

This list contains only stage 1 proposals and higher that have not yet been withdrawn/rejected, or become finished.

javascript

item.title: Issues
item.description:
Issue #7

PWA Tips Monthly Newsletter

Issue #7 | August 24, 2017

What's New?
Safari Tech Preview 38 includes Service Worker üéâ

Now service worker is included as an experimental feature in safari technology preview 38.

safari service worker
If you‚Äôre a startup, you should not use React üò±

If you‚Äôre a startup, you should not use React (reflecting on the BSD + patents license).

react
Get push about chrome features üîî

Subscribe to your favourite features and stay up-to-date.

chrome push
Bootstrap 4 Beta

Moved from Less to Sass and Flexbox and an improved grid system. Read about more features in our post.

bootstrap
English Accents Map

Watch English accent videos and get an insight into the different ways the language.

pwa react redux firebase

Browser Updates
What's New in Chrome 61 Beta?

JavaScript modules, Payment Request API on desktop, Web Share API, and WebUSB and many more.

chrome
Safari Technology Preview 38

Beacon API by default and Enabled Payment Requests as an experimental feature and more.

safari
Making the web smoother with Edge 16

Independent rendering allows the browser to selectively offload graphics processing to an additional CPU thread, so they can be rendered with minimal impact.

edge
What‚Äôs new in Opera 47?

Opera 47 (based on Chromium 60) for Mac, Windows, Linux is out! To find out what's new for users, see our blog post.

opera
What's new in Firefox v55?

Firefox on Windows is the first desktop browser to support the new WebVR standard (and macOS support is in Nightly!)

firefox
Samsung Internet beta v6.2

For the first time, Samsung Internet is becoming available for all Android L+ phones! Plus CSS Grid and lots more.

samsung

Editor Updates
What's new in VS Code Editor v1.15?

Find in markdown preview, color picker UI, auto indent, emmet 2.0 and more.

vscode
What's new in Atom Editor v1.19?

Improved responsiveness and memory usage, editor rendering layer rewrite and more.

atom

Articles & Tutorials
Estimating Available Storage Space in chrome

Chrome 61, with more browsers to follow, now exposes an estimate of how much storage a web app is using and how much is available.

chrome
React 16 beta updates

The first React 16 beta is now available for public testing. üéâ Installation Instructions The beta has been published to NPM with the tag "next".

react
ES Modules in Node Today!

I‚Äôm excited to announce the release of @std/esm (standard/esm), an opt-in, spec-compliant, ECMAScript (ES) module loader.

node
Whats new in angular-cli v1.3 ?

Add a new optimizer mode, webpack 3 support, proper size reporting and more.

angular
How JavaScript works in v8 engine?

A JavaScript engine is a program or an interpreter which executes JavaScript code.

javascript v8 engine

item.title: Issues
item.description:
Issue #6

PWA Tips Monthly Newsletter

Issue #6 | July 26, 2017

What's New?
Goodbye Flash, we wont miss you üò¨

Trend reveals that sites are migrating to open web technologies, which are faster and more power-efficient than Flash.

flash
State of JavaScript 2017 Survey üôè

Let‚Äôs find out what‚Äôs changed since last year in web and especially in javascript.

survey
Whats new in webpack v3.4.0?

Improved optimization bailout messages, Performance improvements in SourceMap DevTool Plugin etc.

webpack
ES8 was Released and here are its Main New Features üî•

The new features of the EcmaScript specification 8th edition.

javascript
Lighthouse data is now used by HTTPArchive

Lighthouse data is now being collected by HTTPArchive 450k+ urls now available in BigQuery.

perf
Chrome release timeline ü§ò

Know chrome release timeline for all the versions.

chrome
Fuel Price a 15kb web application

A preact based pwa which tells you the fuel prices in India.

pwa preact

Browser Updates
What's New In DevTools (Chrome 61)

View storage usage, View when a service worker cached responses, Debugging support for ES6 Modules and many more.

chrome
Safari Technology Preview 36

Improvements to javascript, web inspector and to media API and more.

safari
Microsoft Edge 16

Read Aloud with word and line highlighting, unprefixed CSS Grid is now enabled by default.

edge
Firefox Focus

Firefox Focus blocks annoying ads and protects your privacy.

firefox
Web Audio on different platforms

Taking a look at different behaviors of the Web Audio API.

samsung

Articles & Tutorials
Can we stop bundling yet?

ECMAScript modules have been a boon to the developer community; not only do they allow for organizing code better.

javascript modules
Your next Preact PWA starts in 30 seconds üò∫

CLI tool to create preact apps which is pwa by default, route based code splitting etc,.

preact tools
A look inside React Fiber - how work will get done.

Describing how React Fiber operates, step by step, starting from calling the `render` function in client JS.

react
Detect if your Native app is installed from your web site?

Is your native app already installed? getInstalledRelatedApps is your friend.

pwa chrome
Say hello to HTTP/2 for Node.js Core

Introducing http/2 to node core.

node
Don‚Äôt use jQuery plugins with Shadow DOM

jQuery plugins don‚Äôt work inside of Shadow DOM because typically they try to query for something starting at the document level and the shadow root blocks this.

shadow DOM
Experimenting with the background fetch API

The service worker API is expanding as more ways to use the background dwelling worker emerge.

serviceworker bgsync
Quickly review changed methods and functions in your pull requests

The biggest barrier to code review is often time, but there's a new way to easily understand how changes impact your code.

github

item.title: Issues
item.description:
Issue #5

PWA Tips Monthly Newsletter

Issue #5 | June 20, 2017

What's New?
üöÄ Webpack 3: Official Release!! üöÄ

Now with Scope Hoisting, ‚Äúmagic comments‚Äù, and more!

tools
Shape Shifter

ShapeShifter - SVG icon animation tool for Android, iOS, and the web.

pwa svg
Xylo Phone

Xylo is a simple, vibrant digital xylophone. You can play it with your fingers on touch enabled screens or using the keyboard.

pwa
Fidget Spinner

An offline first web app, that's installable to your home screen across platforms.

pwa
Anonymous Chat

A Preact and Firebase powered progressive web (chat) application.

pwa firebase
ECMASyntax

ECMASyntax is an offline-first PWA designed for developers. It aims to provide a reference for JavaScript syntax, detailing what pieces of syntax do, and how to use them.

pwa javascript

Browser Updates
Chrome 60 Beta

Paint Timing API, CSS font-display, and Credential Management API improvements.

chrome
What's new in Safari v11.0?

What are the new features introduced in versions of Safari.

safari
What's new in Microsoft Edge?

Check out what has been added to microsoft edge browser.

edge
Firefox 54: E10S-Multi, WebExtension APIs, CSS clip-path.‚Ä®

The release of Firefox 54 completes the transformation of Firefox into a fully multi-process browser, running many simultaneous content processes in addition to a UI.

firefox
Bringing AR to the Web ‚Äì Samsung Internet Developers

The day you can interact with the world through the web is a lot closer than you think.

samsung

Articles & Tutorials
The Illusion of Speed

If you could take a 50% hit in real world performance and get a site that feels 50% faster, would you?

performance
Github's New community tools

We're introducing two new tools to help maintain and grow open source communities.

github
The Ultimate Guide to Progressive Web Applications

Progressive Web Apps, aka PWAs, are the best way for developers to make their webapps load faster and more performant.

pwa
Automated testing with Headless Chrome

If you want to run automated tests using Headless Chrome, look no further! This article will get you all set up using Karma as a runner and Mocha+Chai for authoring tests.

chrome testing
Improving time-to-logo performance with preload links

One of the goals of the Wikimedia Performance Team is to improve the performance of MediaWiki and the broader software stack used on Wikimedia wikis.

performance
Upgrading from Node 6 to Node 8: a real-world performance comparison

Node 8 is out, did you hear? And it‚Äôs faster, or so they say.

node
An intro to web components

An intro to web components with otters

web components
Mozilla Thimble to learn CSS and JavaScript

Thimble is an online code editor that makes it easy to create and publish your own web pages while learning HTML, CSS & JavaScript.

mozilla

item.title: Issues
item.description:
Issue #4

PWA Tips Monthly Newsletter

Issue #4 | May 4th, 2017

What's New?
Ola Cabs

Ola drives mobility for a billion Indians with Progressive Web App.

pwa
Spotlight

The fastest way to find movies now playing in cinemas and to discover popular movies and series.

pwa
Web at Microsoft

Discover what microsoft have to offer for Web.

web microsoft
Service Worker Security FAQ

Service worker security faq from chromium developers

browser security
Material Money

A fast, offline-friendly, Material Design-inspired currency converter.

pwa
Material Components for the Web

Create beautiful apps with modular and customizable UI components..

web components
Introducing GitHub for Atom.

The GitHub package will come bundled with Atom 1.18.

editor atom

Browser Updates
What's New In DevTools (Chrome 60)

New Audits panel, powered by Lighthouse.

chrome devtools
Responsive Design for Motion.

WebKit now supports the prefers-reduced-motion media feature, part of CSS Media Queries Level 5, User Preferences.

safari
Microsoft Edge at Build 2017

Microsoft welcomed thousands of developers from around the world to Build 2017, where we shared our vision for the future of dozens of products and services.

edge
Announcing Samsung Internet v5.4 stable

Samsung Internet version 5.4 is now being released in our stable channel..

samsung
Opera is Reborn

Earlier this year we also presented Opera Neon, a concept browser that gave you a glimpse into the future of desktop browsers.

opera
Accessibility improvements in EdgeHTML 15

In last year‚Äôs Windows 10 Anniversary Update, we introduced a new architecture for web accessibility, enabling a more accessible web with Microsoft Edge.

edge

Articles & Tutorials
Rebuilding Slack‚Äôs Emoji Picker in React

Slack is transitioning its web client to React. When Slack was first built, our frontend consisted of established technologies like jQuery and Handlebars.

slack
Financial Times increases engagement with personalisation, speed

The Financial Times is one of the world‚Äôs leading news organisations, with more than 846,000 paid for subscribers, 647,000 of which are digital.

article
Fluent Design System

Microsoft launches the Fluent Design System, its take on Google‚Äôs Material Design.

microsoft design
React DevTools

If you're benchmarking or experiencing performance problems in your React apps.

react
Twitter Lite PWA casestudy

Twitter is a platform to find out what‚Äôs happening in the world..

pwacase study
Mynet PWA casestudy

Twitter is a platform to find out what‚Äôs happening in the world..

pwacase study
Rearchitecting Airbnb‚Äôs Frontend

We recently rethought the architecture for the JavaScript side of our codebase at Airbnb.

article
